properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 8:44AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River Near Rockport affecting Copiah and Simpson Counties
Pearl River Near Monticello affecting Lawrence County
Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County

SYNOPSIS...

Heavy rainfall event is moving into the region beginning Monday
and going through Thursday.  These crests are based on 48 hours
of rainfall. Since this is only the first 2 days of the rainfall,
crest could go higer based on additional heavy rainfall beyond
48 hours.

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River Near Monticello
* from Tuesday morning until further notice.
* At  8:15 AM Sunday the stage was 21.4 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Tuesday morning
and will continue to rise to near 24.0 feet by next Sunday.
* Impact...At 24.0 feet...Water appears in low areas in the extreme
eastern portion of the city of Monticello.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
